hey, im currently updating using the dist upgrade thing, and its taking literally forever (14 k/s!!) so im downloading the iso... question is, is it safe to kill this dist upgrade thing using system monitor and how do i upgrade using the livecd?
i dont really want to reformat, is that the only way?
you're using apt-get?
im using the update manager -c
and its downloading at 14 k/s
which will finish in like a day
if so, it's quite safe to control-c it, edit your /etc/apt/sources.list to use a faster mirror and restart the command.  it'll continue where it left off.
where do i get a list of mirrors
I don't know what update-manager -c does, so I can't advise on that, sorry.  I would guess it's OK to do the same as I suggested, but I don't know.
basically it just launches the update manager to download/upgrade... and ill try that ljl
can i paste that into the sources.list and it shall upgrade faster?
I put a list of mirrors which seem to be working and up-to-date here: http://s89213869.onlinehome.us/mirrors.txt
so i pick one of those mirrors and replace it wherever i see like "deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu edgy-security main"
leave the security lines alone.  but you can change the rest.  the lines in that file are complete sources.list lines, they're just base URLs
so basically just replace archive.ubuntu.com with whatever
for example, I'm using this line now, and getting good speed (but then, I'm close to germany): deb http://de.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu edgy           main restricted universe multiverse
ok ill try adding a us. to the archive and see if that changes anything
so i can just kill the update manager and run it again and it should just start up where it took off?
ok i shall do that
and if it complains about "bad signatures", beware.  it might mean that the mirror can't be trusted.
